html:
Open the pod bay doors please, HAL

On being polite to AI

Bowman: Open the pod bay doors please, HAL.
HAL: I’m sorry, Dave. I’m afraid I can’t do that.

If politeness didn’t help Mission Commander Dave Bowman deal with an artificial intelligence, why would it help you?

Suddenly I’m seeing posts admonishing me not to be polite to AIs. Naturally, my first question was whether the posts were AI-generated. My next question was why this is now a thing. (Yes, I know everything is now a thing, but why is this thing now a thing?)

So I did as one does. I asked an AI: “Perplexity, please tell me why people are suddenly telling me to stop being polite to AIs.”

Though Perplexity’s response was, as usual, helpful, I didn’t thank it. I’d been warned. (I’m hoping I’ll be forgiven for the please I let slip into the prompt itself.) I then asked Perplexity to summarize its response in three short bullets:

  • AIs don’t have feelings, so politeness isn’t necessary.
  • Direct language makes communication clearer and faster.
  • Some worry politeness humanizes AIs too much, blurring lines with real people.

Notably, Perplexity’s answer didn’t explain the nowness part of my question.
